title: The X GAMES
body_text:
BACKGROUND & PRODUCTION
ECD:10
, also known as the
10 Year Anniversary
and
X Games
, will be the 204th
East Coast Dodgeball
event scheduled for August 22, 2015 at 5:45pm. The host venue is Wall High School which will hold its 179th presentation.
ECD:10
will feature one main event and one secondary attraction that both involve members of the past and present roster.
MAIN EVENT
ECD:10's
primary attraction will see
Kevin Megill, Justin Wolf, and Justin Pierce versus Michael Edwards, Juan Londono, and Tom Adams
in a standard 3-vs-3 captains confrontation. Each of the leading generals were inducted into the
ECDElite
Hall of Fame since its inception at
ECD175
.
THE CAST
MEGILL
- #1 ranked player circa ECD 40-60 and remained a constant in the Top 3 until shoulder injury at 175; record 7x "Excellence Award" recipient; headlined 30, 80, 95, 130, 166*, 174^, and 198*.
WOLF
- ranked in  Top 3 defensive players all-time; 1 of just 4 players to win both Rimshot Contest and Battle Royal during career; headlined events 140, 169*, 190, and 198*.
PIERCE
- 1 of only 2 players in ECD history ranked in the Top 10 between events 1-200; 5x (and only) Hit The Human Contest volunteer victim; headlined 3 major events out of a slim 5 total matches
EDWARDS
- Top 10 player throughout entire career from ECD 47-200; 2x (most all-time) Championship Chase champion; headlined events 80, 95, 100, 145, and 184^.
LONDONO
- ECD's remarkable "Cinderella Story"; only player to win
Pick Your Poison, CREAmation Rules, & GodMode Rules
matches; headlined events 115, 140, and 150.
ADAMS
- Top 3 most accurate player and 3rd best overall offense; only player to win "Main Event Star" award; headlined events 15, 50, 90, 117*.
* = Holiday special such as Thanksgiving, Christmas, or Memorial Day
^ = August Summer Showdown special attraction
SELECTION PROCESS & TEAM FORMATION
The selection process was finalized after an estimated six month deliberation. About his choice in combatants, behind-the-scenes facilitator, The Writer, explained that none of the
DODGEBOWL 200
captains were eligible and that "a new cast should headline this major milestone in an effort to be fair to equally legendary figures."
The placement of captains into the 3-man co-captained teams was overseen by The Writer, with input from
ECDElitists
Christoper Adams and Diana DiBuccio. The stakes of the encounter are reported "sky high."
"Like most six-person confrontations, the well-documented history of each individual player involved creates, at the minimum, a chance at finality. For instance, take ECD115: the mighty trio of Kevin Fitzpatrick, Ray Marzarella, and Juan Londono clashed with Chris Adams, Sascha Basista, and Rob Avakian in, as the fitting tagline read, 'the war to settle the (tie) scores.' An encounter ten years in the making must meet and certainly exceed the same criteria.
ECD:10
has struck more than the imagination could handle."
OPPOSITIONAL CONFLICT
ECD's
statisticians have discovered several historical points of interests pertaining to major rivalries of the past -
► Megill has defeated every opponent he's ever faced
except
Edwards; Megill lost at 80 and tied at 95. Should Megill win, he'll be the first and only
ECDElitist
to beat every challenger placed in front of him.
ECD:10
will be Megill's first six-person contest; Edwards, meanwhile, will tie for most-ever having previously co-captained on three separate occasions, winning the first-ever 3-vs-3 at
ECD100
.
► The highly-regarded Londono-Wolf rivalry witnessed matches held at events 140, 142, and 158. Londono holds the comfortable 2-0-1 edge. This will be Wolf's first-ever co-captaincy match, the last of the
ECDElite
to partake in either a 2-on-2 or 3-on-3. In comparison, Londono has never lost a 3-on-3 contest.
► At
ECD90
, Pierce defeated Adams in an acclaimed battle. The next event, Adams no-showed their scheduled return bout stipulated under
CREAMation Rules
. In a 2015 interview, Pierce verbally requested a rematch with Adams stating specifically "We were supposed to have a
CREAMation
but he never showed up."
ECD
history also offers these unique pieces of information -
► Pierce and Edwards were victorious co-captains at
ECD100
, the inaugural six-person encounter in history. Eighty-four events later, they met on opposing sides at the subtitled "Star Wars" showdown that ended in a 5-5 draw.
ECD:10
is their second match against one another.
► Megill defeated Londono at
ECD79
, a record-shattering 17-point margin of victory that still stands today. A Megill triumph at
ECD:10
will make him the 6th individual to win the "triple crown" of captaincy, that being victories in 1-vs-1, 2-vs-2, and 3-vs-3 matches; Londono was the 2nd to accomplish this feat and completed such in the shortest amount of time at a mere 37 events.
► Adams has never won a co-captaincy match, although his only effort was in a 2-on-2 at
ECD50
. Additionally, Adams has not been a captain since
ECD117
, the longest drought among the
ECD:10
headliners.
► Lastly, Londono and Pierce currently hold unbeaten streaks dating back to their origins at events 98 and 90, respectively. Since then, Londono's streak remains the longest in ECD history at 5-0-2; Pierce is 3-0-1.
ALLIANCE BREAKDOWN
► Megill, Wolf, Pierce: Despite being teammates, Megill and Wolf have fought twice before, the most recent a 12-3
CREAMation
slaughter in favor of Megill. Megill is also a member of Team ALL and will have to co-exist with his WALL counterparts.
► Edwards, Londono, Adams: The Londono-Adams feud was nominated for 2007 Rivalry of the Year. Londono would have aligned with Pierce at
ECD91
to face Adams, but Adams no-showed the event. Adams represents Team WALL while Edwards and Londono comprise a major part of Team ALL.
The Writer also noted that "none of the teammates have ever joined forces together. That is the most important part."
SECONDARY ATTRACTION
ECD:10's
special contest will be the 21st Rimshot Contest coined the
"StopaShot Contest"
. The bonus mini-game is named in honor of
ECDElite
Hall of Famer, Lauren Stopa, for her years of pinpoint accuracy and championship victory at the 15th Rimshot Contest.
All competitors and spectators are eligible to partake. A mystery prize will be awarded to the champion. Admission is free.
EXTERNAL LINKS
ECD Official Facebook Page
ECD:10
Facebook Event Page
ECD80: Edwards meets Megill in debut match
ECD90: Pierce vs. T. Adams
ECD91: Pierce vs. T. Adams, The Rematch?
ECD140: Wolf-Juan Part I
ECD158: Wolf vs. Juan in GodMode Rules
ECD178: Stopa claims 15th Rimshot Contest
ECD184: Star Wars
body_html:
• BACKGROUND & PRODUCTION

    • ECD:10, also known as the 10 Year Anniversary and X Games, will be the 204th East Coast Dodgeball event scheduled for August 22, 2015 at 5:45pm. The host venue is Wall High School which will hold its 179th presentation.

    ECD:10 will feature one main event and one secondary attraction that both involve members of the past and present roster.

  • MAIN EVENT
    ECD:10's primary attraction will see Kevin Megill, Justin Wolf, and Justin Pierce versus Michael Edwards, Juan Londono, and Tom Adams in a standard 3-vs-3 captains confrontation. Each of the leading generals were inducted into the ECDElite Hall of Fame since its inception at ECD175.

  • THE CAST
    MEGILL - #1 ranked player circa ECD 40-60 and remained a constant in the Top 3 until shoulder injury at 175; record 7x "Excellence Award" recipient; headlined 30, 80, 95, 130, 166*, 174^, and 198*.
    WOLF - ranked in Top 3 defensive players all-time; 1 of just 4 players to win both Rimshot Contest and Battle Royal during career; headlined events 140, 169*, 190, and 198*.
    PIERCE - 1 of only 2 players in ECD history ranked in the Top 10 between events 1-200; 5x (and only) Hit The Human Contest volunteer victim; headlined 3 major events out of a slim 5 total matches
    EDWARDS - Top 10 player throughout entire career from ECD 47-200; 2x (most all-time) Championship Chase champion; headlined events 80, 95, 100, 145, and 184^.
    LONDONO - ECD's remarkable "Cinderella Story"; only player to win Pick Your Poison, CREAmation Rules, & GodMode Rules matches; headlined events 115, 140, and 150.
    ADAMS - Top 3 most accurate player and 3rd best overall offense; only player to win "Main Event Star" award; headlined events 15, 50, 90, 117*.
    * = Holiday special such as Thanksgiving, Christmas, or Memorial Day
    ^ = August Summer Showdown special attraction

  • SELECTION PROCESS & TEAM FORMATION
    The selection process was finalized after an estimated six month deliberation. About his choice in combatants, behind-the-scenes facilitator, The Writer, explained that none of the DODGEBOWL 200 captains were eligible and that "a new cast should headline this major milestone in an effort to be fair to equally legendary figures."

    The placement of captains into the 3-man co-captained teams was overseen by The Writer, with input from ECDElitists Christoper Adams and Diana DiBuccio. The stakes of the encounter are reported "sky high."

    "Like most six-person confrontations, the well-documented history of each individual player involved creates, at the minimum, a chance at finality. For instance, take ECD115: the mighty trio of Kevin Fitzpatrick, Ray Marzarella, and Juan Londono clashed with Chris Adams, Sascha Basista, and Rob Avakian in, as the fitting tagline read, 'the war to settle the (tie) scores.' An encounter ten years in the making must meet and certainly exceed the same criteria. ECD:10 has struck more than the imagination could handle."

    OPPOSITIONAL CONFLICT
    ECD's statisticians have discovered several historical points of interests pertaining to major rivalries of the past -
    ► Megill has defeated every opponent he's ever faced except Edwards; Megill lost at 80 and tied at 95. Should Megill win, he'll be the first and only ECDElitist to beat every challenger placed in front of him. ECD:10 will be Megill's first six-person contest; Edwards, meanwhile, will tie for most-ever having previously co-captained on three separate occasions, winning the first-ever 3-vs-3 at ECD100.
    ► The highly-regarded Londono-Wolf rivalry witnessed matches held at events 140, 142, and 158. Londono holds the comfortable 2-0-1 edge. This will be Wolf's first-ever co-captaincy match, the last of the ECDElite to partake in either a 2-on-2 or 3-on-3. In comparison, Londono has never lost a 3-on-3 contest.
    ► At ECD90, Pierce defeated Adams in an acclaimed battle. The next event, Adams no-showed their scheduled return bout stipulated under CREAMation Rules. In a 2015 interview, Pierce verbally requested a rematch with Adams stating specifically "We were supposed to have a CREAMation but he never showed up."

    ECD history also offers these unique pieces of information -
    ► Pierce and Edwards were victorious co-captains at ECD100, the inaugural six-person encounter in history. Eighty-four events later, they met on opposing sides at the subtitled "Star Wars" showdown that ended in a 5-5 draw. ECD:10 is their second match against one another.
    ► Megill defeated Londono at ECD79, a record-shattering 17-point margin of victory that still stands today. A Megill triumph at ECD:10 will make him the 6th individual to win the "triple crown" of captaincy, that being victories in 1-vs-1, 2-vs-2, and 3-vs-3 matches; Londono was the 2nd to accomplish this feat and completed such in the shortest amount of time at a mere 37 events.
    ► Adams has never won a co-captaincy match, although his only effort was in a 2-on-2 at ECD50. Additionally, Adams has not been a captain since ECD117, the longest drought among the ECD:10 headliners.
    ► Lastly, Londono and Pierce currently hold unbeaten streaks dating back to their origins at events 98 and 90, respectively. Since then, Londono's streak remains the longest in ECD history at 5-0-2; Pierce is 3-0-1.

    ALLIANCE BREAKDOWN
    ► Megill, Wolf, Pierce: Despite being teammates, Megill and Wolf have fought twice before, the most recent a 12-3 CREAMation slaughter in favor of Megill. Megill is also a member of Team ALL and will have to co-exist with his WALL counterparts.

    ► Edwards, Londono, Adams: The Londono-Adams feud was nominated for 2007 Rivalry of the Year. Londono would have aligned with Pierce at ECD91 to face Adams, but Adams no-showed the event. Adams represents Team WALL while Edwards and Londono comprise a major part of Team ALL.

    The Writer also noted that "none of the teammates have ever joined forces together. That is the most important part."

  • SECONDARY ATTRACTION
    ECD:10's special contest will be the 21st Rimshot Contest coined the "StopaShot Contest". The bonus mini-game is named in honor of ECDElite Hall of Famer, Lauren Stopa, for her years of pinpoint accuracy and championship victory at the 15th Rimshot Contest.

    All competitors and spectators are eligible to partake. A mystery prize will be awarded to the champion. Admission is free.
